statement.p: Istas is conducting market research on the cost of a cell phone data plan. Istas has determined that the average annual cost of a cell phone data plan is 814, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 95.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 753 on a cell phone data plan.
b. The cost of the middle 30 of cell phone data plans falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 16 of cell phone data plans cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 30 of the data, need the remaining 70 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution.
